item.description:
Let's enjoy Crane's beach and follow trails and boardwalks through sand dunes and salt marshes, as the colors of the sea and sky change in the afternoon and early evening.

Non-member admission this time of year is $7 per car.

Then we'll head for the best espresso and ice cream place around, Zumi's! Take a look at the menu, yum!
http://www.zumis.com/...
40 Market St. Ipswich

Another possibility for snacks and drinks is:
The Farm Bar & Grille
farmbargrille@gmail.com
233 Western Avenue
Route 22
Essex, MA 01929
978-768-0000

or for traditional seafood
Ipswich Clambake Co.
ipswichclambake@verizon.net
196 High Street
Ipswich, MA 01938
978-356-2050

Off-season the park closes at sunset, so we will be able to photograph changing colors of the sky, and sea until then.

The beach is managed for both recreation and conservation through careful planning. More than 5 miles of trails wind through coastal dunes here.flooding. Castle Neck is the site of the North Shoreâ€™s largest pitch pine forest.

Crane Beach has been nationally recognized for its successful shorebird protection program.

5.5 miles of trails traverse dunes and track the beachfront on both the Ipswich Bay and Essex River Estuary sides of the Castle Neck peninsula.

Here's the website for Crane's Beach:
[url=http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/northeast-ma/crane-beach-on-the-crane.html]

From Rt. 128 North Exit 20A, take Rt. 1A north for 8 mi. to Ipswich. Turn right onto Rt. 133 East and follow for 1.5 mi. Turn left onto Northgate Rd. and follow for 0.5 mi. Turn right onto Argilla Rd. and follow for 2.5 mi. to entrance and parking (1,300 cars) at end of road.

It is suggested that we all download and print trail maps so we can decide together as a group which trails to take.

Trail maps to download and print:
http://www.thetrustee...
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet near the buildings at the parking lot.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Crane's Beach stroll now earlier! w/coffee & food options later!
